result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Complete any other assessments or evaluations as deemed aprpopriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay restitution of $550 to Altra Federal Credit Union

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to DA's office (see 'other' above)

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 19 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's prison inmate funds are to be applied toward restitution owed
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

The defendant is to comply with and complete any treatment and/or assessments started in prison

Pay restitution of $550 as originally ordered

During period of extended supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay costs/fees as originally ordered

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
